intro: Cyathula globosa, commonly known as the globular spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its distinctive, globe-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. The plant has a succulent, fleshy stem and leaves that are often arranged in a rosette pattern. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many other spurge species. Cyathula globosa is often used in ornamental gardening due to its unique appearance and hardy nature.
